p: Our framework also captures how intermediate hosts, such as livestock, can play key bridging roles in such spillover events. Bridging species have been particularly important for many of the most serious bat-derived human pathogens, including the horse for Hendra virus [ 12], the pig for the initial emergence of Nipah virus [ 49], non-human primates in the case of Ebola [ 50, 51] and the palm civet in the case of SARS-coronavirus [ 52]. The disease impact on bridging species can have severe human wellbeing implications in its own right, as exemplified by the decimation of the pig industry in Malaysia as a consequence of Nipah virus emergence [ 53].
